@opiejeanne @davidmoffitt @j_quadrifrons @KCMOPro @dcmichaelrose It follows US Highway 2 for most of that time, so there’s more signal than one might expect.
@ternoveau @436bGliese @wideofthepost @haymarketbooks Exactly. Javert was indeed a tragic hero. The system failed _everyone_. Miserably. (At least we have space weapons and Netflix now, so progress?)
@BMunise @offlineleft That makes us look even worse!
@SherlockHemloc2 @wideofthepost Drug crimes are signs of systemic societal dysfunction. Until we confront that, any ‘war on drugs’ has less chance of sustained success than a land war in Asia.
@propcharles @jcschmieder @wideofthepost Or leave your doors unlocked with a $20 on the seat.

@jcschmieder @wideofthepost The same ‘innocent’ residents that routinely drive by their unhoused cousins and do little or nothing to help? (help can be provided in many non-financial ways - being active in local politics, befriending folks on the street, etc…)
@436bGliese @wideofthepost @haymarketbooks It’s a terrible tragic tale. Javert worked so hard, from nothing, and all he ever wanted was respect for doing the right thing.

@pattyheffley @Sallamoon1 @joeyfox85 A damp towel placed over an inexpensive box fan not only cools (slightly) the air but humidifies it as well. A pan of water left on top of a radiator or inside a sunny winter window helps with humidity, too.

@Kelsie_McVeety @the_tweedy A non-preferred name shouldn’t appear _anywhere_ on paperwork or computer screens past reception. (If it has to appear for some legal/regulatory reason, in should be in a very tiny font away from other names.)

@brydone_jack @AlissaEvenson @TSevert @Fad1878 Perhaps they’re used to rural providers not having good equipment to read disks… also, a cracked film is readable; a cracked CD might not be. (also, the film is likely to still be readable in 20 years… but will a computer with CD drive be common in 2040?)
@TeeDee32390904 @LadiRadi Apparently there exist machinations that cause many defendants to ‘waive’ that right…

@Gotgoodies_ @amarelovex @izumabakumatsu @Peckham_Heights @OneMileataTime Agricultural field workers _finally_ have normal minimum wage (and overtime) eligibility in Washington State, and the sub-minimum wage for tipped restaurant workers has been gone in many western states for some time now. Progress, yes, but slow and regional.

@amarelovex @Gotgoodies_ @izumabakumatsu @Peckham_Heights @OneMileataTime When the minimum wage laws were originally passed, several major categories of jobs (that were mostly held by women and minorities with no political power) were excluded, e.g.: - restaurant servers, - agricultural field workers, and - disabled workers in special ‘workshops’.
